title: If the cost price of 12 oranges is equal to the selling price of 10 oranges, then what is the percentage of profit? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let C.P. of 12 oranges is Rs.x , then C.P. of an orange =Rs.x/12. S.P.of 10 orange = C.P.of 12 oranges = Rs.x. , thus S.P.of an orange = Rs.x/10. Profit = Rs.( x/10 - x/12) = Rs.x/60. Profit % = (x/60)×100/(x/12) = 20 %. Answer.

We know that Profit% =( Profit/Cost Price) ×100 According to the question, 12CP=10SP Thus SP/CP=6/5 So assume CP of the orange is Rs. 5 so SP will be Rs. 6 Therefore , Profit percent = (6-5)/5×100 = 20%
